text: 1,3 Butadiene MSVP smoke yield assessment of processed and non-
processed tobaccos and related leaf constituents.
Project Type: (Click on box and type "X")
(Brief description of project: 1) background / rationale 2) final deliverable 3) resource requirements
1) Background / Rationale - 1,3-butadiene is one of a series of compounds of interest known to be
present in mainstream vapor phase (MSVP) cigarette smoke. There have been a number of reports
describing the MSVP smoke yield of 1,3-butadiene in a variety of cigarette prototypes. Reduced risk
products such as Eclipse and Advance Ultra Lights have been shown to have reduction in MSVP smoke
yields on a ug/cigarette basis. The presence of 1,3-butadiene has been confirmed in the pyrolysis of
cigarette paper at 800 C and in the pyrolysis of selected pulps. Paper and cellulose pyrolysis experiments
at lower temperatures have not indicated the presence of 1,3-butadiene. Preliminary data on cigarettes
containing only one type of tobacco or tobacco material has indicated there may be meaningful
differences in the amount of 1,3-butadiene produced per mg of IPM. Thus, there appears to be both a
temperature and material influence on the yield of 1,3-butadiene from tobacco and or tobacco materials.
Hence, in an effort to further define the conditions necessary for the production of 1,3 butadiene and
possibly provide a mechanism for the preparation of reduced risk products having reduced 1,3-butadiene
yields, a series of experiments surrounding 1,3-butadiene yields as function of tobacco material and
2) Final Deliverable - The final deliverable will be to further understand the relationship of tobacco type
and 1,3 Butadiene yields and the creation of a data base for future reduced risk product development.
3) Resource Requirements - 0.75 FTE (Analytical Services), 0.25 (Product Development) and 0.25
